ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 601
ygData.msgSnippet: Message: 21 Date: Wed, 9 Oct 2002 11:40:28 -0700 (PDT) From: David Langille  Subject: Re: freeeqguides Steven Hulse wrote: Hmm,
ygData.messageBody:
Message: 21
   Date: Wed, 9 Oct 2002 11:40:28 -0700 (PDT)
   From: David Langille <tuxedomystery2000@...>

Subject: Re: freeeqguides


Steven Hulse wrote:
'Hmm, not sure why my messages aren't showing up for some but I do
apologize. It's something funky with my mail I guess."

aw, mail's messing up for me too.

<Steve> Stupid Yahoo!

"Anyway to answer your email David, I do understand where your
coming from but for me that's the whole point. last night is a good
example, I got over to Dagnor's and unfortunately went the wrong way
and got killed, (several times), while trying to recover my body. I
also was bound over in WF so that made the trip even more fun! One of
my guildmates and a necro from another guild came to my aid but
before this happened we spent the majority of the evening trying to
get my corpse."

:( Why did it take you so long to get your corpse?

<I was based in West Freeport and I had to take the boat back each time which was the big delay. Plus I was naked the first two times and got jumped. The third time was when a fellow guildmate and a necro stepped in to help. Just the fact I had to keep taking the boat back and forgetting to re-bind is what was so funny about it.

"To answer the issue of getting invites, well I really don't
have that much of a problem getting them. My Ranger is invited
because of her skills in track and sence heading more than for her
"gear"."

:) you're lucky. I always hear that them and halflings are the butt
of all jokes. and btw, how do you show them that you have high track
and sense heading?

<Steve> They usually ask and I provide the info. Plus my Ranger is kind of "known" over in GF from helping out so many others. I bult up those abilities by making them the first two hotbuttons and then mapping my left and right arrow keys to them. So when I turn left i activate my Sense Heading and when i turn Right I activate my Track. You can do this under the Options selection.

"My Gnome Warrior is invited alot by lower to mid level classes
to help them with exp and funds. Mostly because I enjoy it and don't
really care about my own personal gains."

Gnome warrior? That must make some good roleplaying.

<Steve> Oh man it's a blast! When I created him I wanted to do something obscure and figured what better than a Gnome! Who would expect such a little guy to whup so much butt! Man he's fun! He's also quickly starting to become my favorite. I think this is also the reason for the invites, Heck watching a Gnome go at it on an Orc leigonare is just funny!

"My Mage is just coming up but he gets invited alot too mostly
becuase he can take care of his own pretty well without his
magic."

ok, um, how's that possible?

<Steve> Well when I was able to aquire some funds and was able to purchase a decent piercing weapon he could use I got that and then just started physically attacking instead of casting. believe it or not a Mage can become a pretty decent fighter but it takes time. Plus he's only lvl10 and the availability of spells I've been able to find aren't the most impressive so I tried to compensate for that. I don't suggest using them as tanks but as for a solo character they are fun. Now I was very consious about what I attacked and made sure I was able to hang in there or be able to run if needed. It's nice to have this ability as a backup in case you run out of mana! Right now I'm able to take on 4 Grikbar Kobolds without magic and kill them all. Actually I think it all started because I kept getting frustrated because I kept having trouble casting.

and gtg, i will finish this later.

<Steve> Cool! C-ya later!

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Steven R. Hulse Durgaa: Lvl12 FWE Ranger member of Causality Guild Genmay: lvl13 MGne Warrior Member of Causality Shizney: Lvl11 MGne Magician ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
